---
title: "import_single_namespace_foo.json"
---

## High-level description
This JSON file defines a configuration for feature flags and user segments within a single namespace called "foo". It includes two feature flags with different types and configurations, as well as a user segment definition with constraints.

## Code Structure
The JSON structure consists of a root object with three main properties: "namespace", "flags", and "segments". The "flags" and "segments" properties are arrays containing detailed configurations for feature flags and user segments, respectively.

## Symbols

### Root Object
#### Description
The root object represents the entire configuration for the "foo" namespace.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| namespace | string | The namespace identifier |
| flags | array | An array of feature flag configurations |
| segments | array | An array of user segment configurations |

### Flag Object
#### Description
Represents a single feature flag configuration.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Display name for the flag |
| type | string | Type of the flag (e.g., "VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE", "BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE") |
| description | string | Description of the flag's purpose |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is enabled or not |
| variants | array | (Optional) Array of variant configurations for variant flags |
| rules | array | (Optional) Array of rule configurations for variant flags |
| rollouts | array | (Optional) Array of rollout configurations for boolean flags |

### Variant Object
#### Description
Represents a variant configuration for a variant flag.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the variant |
| name | string | Display name for the variant |
| description | string | Description of the variant |
| attachment | object | (Optional) Additional data attached to the variant |

### Rule Object
#### Description
Represents a rule configuration for a variant flag.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| segment | string | The segment key this rule applies to |
| rank | number | The rank of the rule |
| distributions | array | Array of distribution configurations |

### Rollout Object
#### Description
Represents a rollout configuration for a boolean flag.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| description | string | Description of the rollout |
| segment | object | (Optional) Segment configuration for the rollout |
| threshold | object | (Optional) Threshold configuration for the rollout |

### Segment Object
#### Description
Represents a user segment configuration.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Display name for the segment |
| match_type | string | Type of matching for the segment (e.g., "ANY_MATCH_TYPE") |
| description | string | Description of the segment's purpose |
| constraints | array | Array of constraint configurations |

### Constraint Object
#### Description
Represents a constraint configuration for a user segment.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | Type of the constraint (e.g., "STRING_COMPARISON_TYPE") |
| property | string | The property to be evaluated |
| operator | string | The comparison operator (e.g., "neq") |
| value | string | The value to compare against |

## Dependencies
This JSON file does not have any external dependencies. It is a self-contained configuration file.

## Configuration
The file itself serves as a configuration for feature flags and user segments. The main configuration options are:

| Option | Type | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------------|
| namespace | string | Defines the namespace for the configuration |
| flags | array | Contains the feature flag configurations |
| segments | array | Contains the user segment configurations |

## API/Interface Reference
While this JSON file doesn't directly expose an API, it defines a structure that could be used by a feature flag management system. The main interfaces are:

| Entity | Description |
|:-------|:------------|
| Flags | Defines feature flags with variants, rules, and rollouts |
| Segments | Defines user segments with constraints for targeting |

This configuration could be consumed by a feature flag management system to control feature availability and targeting for different user segments.
